articles.title: Delaying antibiotic treatment does not reduce survival chances in cancer patients with neutropenic fever - News-Medical.Net
articles.description: In cancer patients with neutropenic fever, delaying antibiotic treatment past 60 minutes from the time of fever detection does not reduce the short-term chance of survival, according to a study in the American Journal of Medical Quality.
